intro: Pholidota khasyana, commonly known as the Khasi pholidota, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
